numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I looked at the graph.
2. I noticed a difference between young women and young men.
3. More young women contact a parent at least once a day than young men.
4. More young women contact a parent a few times a week than young men.
5. Some young men live away from their parents.
6. Some young women live away from their parents.
7. Less young men contact a parent than young women when they live away from their parents.
8. I wonder if a scientific reason explains this difference.
9. I wonder if a generational influence explains this difference.
10. The results in the graph relate to my family.
11. The results in the graph relate to my friends.
12. The results in the graph relate to me.
13. Some of my family members are close to entering college.
14. Some of my friends are close to entering college.
15. I am close to entering college or adulthood.
16. Entering college or adulthood often involves moving away from parents.
17. Entering college or adulthood often involves moving away from childhood homes.
18. When we reach this stage, the graph can help predict how often we will connect with our parents.
19. We can connect with our parents by texting.
20. We can connect with our parents by calling.
21. We can connect with our parents by visiting in person.
22. The people in the sample are close to our ages.
23. The study is recent.
